result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody D Crillo

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on November 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises. Defendant is to have no contact with any known drug dealers/users unless in a therapeutic setting.

12:02 PM Defendant Cody D Crillo in court, in custody.by video from Clark County Jail.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint. Defendant advised of right to an attorney.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Initial appearance on November 8, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
